intro: Rhizophora mucronata var. stylosa, commonly known as the mangrove apple or red mangrove, is a species of mangrove tree native to the Indo-Pacific region. It is characterized by its distinctive aerial roots, which provide structural support and facilitate gas exchange in waterlogged soils.
